ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You should take this class for Professor LeVen alone. Euripides is a great bonus though - his play inspires both intellectual thought and thorough grammar reviews.

Great class if you are moderately to reasonably good at Greek. I put in a lot of hours, but it was never tedious and always pretty enjoyable. Pauline in particular was great -- we spent a lot of time discussing the themes/ideas of the play, but somehow we really stayed focused on the text.If you have the interest, have some time to put into it, and if they offer it with Pauline again, you should definitely take it.
Yes, I would recommend this to another student who feels confident reading approximately 60 to 100 lines before each class (roughly 3 to 4 hours).

Be prepared to do lots of work: the workload is very heavy in this course (both translation and other assignments and evaluations), but the labor is worthwhile. Prof. LeVen is an engaging, knowledgeable, and helpful professor--you will learn a lot about Greek drama, Euripides plays, and Greek grammar.
Absolutely - the text (Helen) is really enjoyable and interesting, and the course is well taught.
